results.title: Breaking up
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenwald, George Moffly, Monarchy Enterprises B. V. and Regency Entertainment (USA)
results.brief_description: Using vignettes, still photos, interviews, and the New York landscape, this film follows the trials and tribulations of Steve (Russell Crowe) and Monica’s (Salma Hayek) tumultuous relationship that vacillates between being together, and breaking up. The two realise that they can’t live with each other, but can’t do without the other either and are trapped in a continuous process of breaking up then making up. Ultimately, they have to decide what it is that’s holding them together when the excitement of their renewed sexual attraction that occurs when they make up seems to be the overarching link between them. Written by Pulitzer Prize winner Michael Cristofer.

results.title: Breaking through...
results.creator_credit: Jackie McKimmie, Richard Mason and Alfred Road Films
results.brief_description: Cathy Ann Matthews had only pleasant and peaceful recollections of her childhood. Not until her own daughter was getting married did the memories of the past come flooding back. This sensitive and moving docu-drama is about a woman coming to terms with the horrible abuse she went through as a child and deals with the way these memories flooded her mind until she became almost suicidal. Stars Deidre Rubenstein, Tony Barry, Gabrielle Mason, Julie Hamilton and Noni Hazlehurst. Based on the book ‘Breaking though: no longer a victim of child abuse’ by Cathy Ann Matthews.

results.title: Breaking through (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Margaret Lupton, Megan Heyward and Kristen Dunphy
results.brief_description: Produced for the Australian Deafness Council, this informative and supportive video encourages deaf students to look positively at a broad range of jobs which they may not have considered. It shows young deaf people at work in a wide variety of fields from professional to unskilled, and looks at some of the problems they may encounter.

results.title: Breaking the waves
results.creator_credit: Lars Von Trier, Peter Aalbaek Jensen, Vibeke Windelov, La Sept Cinema and Zentropa Entertainments
results.brief_description: A moving portrayal of Bess, a devout, innocent woman who lives in an isolated Scottish fishing village. The warmth and love she has found in her marriage to oil-rig worker Jan is shattered by an accident that leaves him paralysed from the neck down. When he encourages Bess to have sex with other men, she is propelled into a personal and religious crisis that the claustrophobic and repressive community of the village only makes worse. The visual style of the film evokes a fly-on-the-wall, documentary feel achieved by Muellers hand-held camerawork. Beyond this filming technique, the wide-screen stock was put through a film-video-film transfer process, muting the colour and producing noticeable grain. Emily Watson won Berlin Film Festival and New York Critics Circle Best Actress awards, and was nominated for an oscar for her finely articulated performance of a woman made victim to the desires and dictates of the men around her. The film won the Grand Jury Prize at Cannes in 1996. Cast includes Emily Watson, Stellan Skarsgard, Katrin Cartlidge, Jean-Marc Barr, Adrian Rawlins and Sandra Voe.

results.title: Breaking the habit
results.creator_credit: John Korty, Henry Jacobs, American Cancer Society and Korty Films
results.brief_description: With the theme: “the self-delusion of the cigarette smoker”, records a conversation between two cartoon characters, George, the “quitting” smoker, and his friend. Concludes on a serious but hopeful note, pointing out that the chances of developing serious diseases decrease the moment you stop smoking.

results.title: Breaking the ice
results.brief_description: Tim Bowden takes us on one of the last greatest adventures - a voyage to the Australian Antarctic Territory in this spectacular 6 part travel series. Over a period of 2 months Tim visited all 4 of Australia’s Antarctic stations at Macquarie Island Casey, Davis and Mawson. The result is a fascinating ‘behind the scenes’ look at what Australians are doing in Antarctica - a wild and beautiful icy wilderness that has attracted adventurers and scientists since the days of Scott, Shackleton and Mawson. Highlight include spectacular views of Australia’s only ice-breaking ship “Aurora Australis” charging through the pack ice, a visit to a new Emperor Penguin colony the day after it was discovered and superb footage of penguins, elephant seals and albatrosses on sub-Antarctic Macquarie Island.

results.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Richard Shepherd, Martin Jurow and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Audrey Hephurn stars as Holly Golightly in the film based on the short story by Truman Capote. Holly’s almost frosty sophistication is only a veneer. Hepburn convey’s Holly’s underlying fragility with poignance and sympathy. George Peppard, as Paul the writer, like Holly is searching to find a place amongst the “fleshpots” and “rats” of New York. As their love blossoms, Paul must come to terms with the fact that Holly is a girl on the run, not only from the past, but from herself. New York, Tiffany’s, Givenchy’s stunning wardrobe for Hepburn, the magical music of Henry Mancini and Johnny Mercer’s song “Moon River”, help make this film a cinema classic. Mickey Rooney as Holly’s slightly deranged Japanese landlord, delights in a hilarious comic cameo.

results.title: Breaking point
results.creator_credit: Brian McDuffie, Justin Milne, South Australian Film Corporation and Newfilms
results.brief_description: Looks at mental breakdown and the treatment of mental disorders by presenting a dramatisation of 2 case studies : a young girl suffering from schizophrenia and a middle aged man who is depressive. Cast includes Marcia Deane-Johns, Leo Taylor, Barbara West, Wayne Bell, Shane Withington.

results.title: Breakdown
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of a young woman’s schizophrenic breakdown, and of her recovery in a modern mental hospital. Inherent in the film is an appeal for greater public understanding of mental illness and for the removal of the stigma that still surrounds it. The film presents the case of a seemingly well-adjusted young woman, showing the disintegration of her personality and the psychiatric treatment that follows.
